questions.question: What are you looking for?
questions.description: Get started by letting us know a little bit about what you need

questions.question: What type of loan are you planning?
questions.description: It will help us to identify your requirements, specifically

questions.question: Please select any one sub-category under Plot Loan.
questions.description: Selecting the correct sub-category for plot loans is essential to avoid confusion in documentation, approval processes, and getting the best interest rates. The right option can simplify these aspects significantly.

questions.question: Please confirm that selected property is situated in officially authorized area by the government?
questions.description: Most of the lenders prefer that your property location should be approved from respective 'City's Development Authority' or 'Municipal Corporation'

errorMessage.message: As your property is not as per map, only NBFC banks can approve your loan. You'll have to search which NBFC working in your location.

questions.question: Please ensure that the construction of the property would be according to the 'approved map' from the respective authority.
questions.description: Lenders can reject loan application if map is not approved by respective authority. Also construction of the property should be as per the approved map.

errorMessage.message: As your property is not as per map, only NBFC banks can approve your loan. You'll have to search which NBFC working in your location.

questions.question: If applicant or any of the co-applicants is NRI?

questions.description: Lenders need to ensure that the property meets legal requirements and compliances related to ownership rights, land tenure, and property transfer.
questions.question: Please indicate the type of ownership for the property?

questions.description: The loan process may vary based on the purchase type, primarily concerning the disbursement of funds and documentation requirements related to the property's stage and ownership transfer.
questions.question: Please specify the nature of property purchase?

questions.description: If the property hasn't been registered, the transaction is termed as 'Endorsement' or 'Builder Transfer'. Legal requirements and disbursement procedures differ from registered property cases. If the seller hasn't completed registration, only selected lenders may approve your loan application (and in unregistered cases we don't provide our services.)
questions.question: Please specify if the selected property is registered in the name of seller(s)?

errorMessage.message: We regret to inform you that we are currently unable to proceed with your request due to our service constraints.

questions.question: What is the total area of Plot?.

questions.description: state name
questions.question: Where your property is located ?
City name
If the residence location is the same as the property location?
questions.description: For an NRI applicant, this should be addressed from the perspective of the GPA (Power of Attorney).
state name
questions.question: Location for residence verification ?
city name

errorMessage.message: Kindly select a different city or update your earlier answer.

questions.question: From where the property is being purchased ?
Enter the name of builder
Enter the name of authority
Please specify if the property is on loan?
questions.description: You'll have to ensure if the seller has an existing loan on the property you're buying, as it can affect your loan options. You may need to use the seller's bank for the loan or have the seller transfer the balance to your chosen bank, which could lead to complications in getting the best terms.

questions.question: Please select lenders, from where project is approved.
questions.description: We will show offers from all the banks/lenders, but final approval depends on whether the project is approved by the respective bank/lender. We recommend checking with the builder or your property broker, as the approved lenders list frequently changes.

questions.question: Select the lender from where seller's loan is running.
What is the foreclosure Amount?
questions.description: This Amount will be paid to the seller's Bank.

questions.question: If seller / any of the seller's is NRI?
Tell us who's applying
questions.description: The applicants whose names are on the property will be included in the loan, as well as those who wish to contribute to loan repayments.

questions.question: What's company type?
questions.description: Select the type of company who is applying for the loan. Be informed, the property should be in the name of company and not in the name of owner or director.

questions.question: How would you like to assess your company’s loan eligibility?
How many family members or directors/partners are applying for the loan?
questions.description: (including the primary applicant)

questions.question: What's the full name of the applicant ?
questions.description: How it appears on PAN, Passport, Aadhaar or Driving license.

questions.question: What's the full name of the Co-applicant ?
questions.description: How it appears on PAN, Passport, Aadhaar or Driving license.

questions.question: Please specify the reason for this person's involvement in the loan?

options.label: Having name on the property papers
options.value: Having name on the property papers

options.label: Loan repayment and having name on the property papers
options.value: Loan repayment and having name on the property papers

questions.question: Is the applicant NRI?
What's your employment status?
If the Provident Fund (PF) is being deducted from salary?(Optional)
questions.description: If PF is not deducted from your salary, your employer might not be registered with certain lenders. This could result in your loan being approved at a higher ROI. Don’t worry; we'll inform you of this before submitting your loan application to your chosen lender.

questions.question: What's the company name?
What is your current age? or years has your company been in business?
questions.description: It is required to assess your loan eligibility and tenure for the loan.

questions.question: What is the monthly gross income?
questions.description: Gross income is your total monthly earnings before deductions (tax, PF, NPS, etc) A few banks use it to assess your loan eligibility

questions.question: What is the monthly net income?
questions.description: Net income is your monthly earnings after deductions (tax, PF, NPS, etc) It is the amount you receive in your bank account as salary

errorMessage.message: Gross income should be greater than or equal to fixed salary

questions.question: What's the additional monthly income from bonuses, incentives, and rental earnings?
questions.description: This includes the average monthly bonus received in the latest financial year (total bonus divided by 12) and the average monthly incentive received in the latest 6 months (total incentive divided by 6). You will need to submit a valid rent agreement, and the rent amount should be reflected in your bank statement Enter zero (0) if there is no additional income

questions.question: Please select your profession.
questions.description: Banks will require you to provide relevant certificates or degrees during the loan application process

questions.question: If Income Tax Returns are available for last three consecutive financial years?

errorMessage.message: We regret to inform you that we are currently unable to proceed with your request due to our service constraints.

questions.question: What were the Gross Receipts in the last three financial years?
What were the Net Profits for the last three financial years?
What's the sum of "Depreciation" and "Interest on Loans" as per profit-loss statement?
What's the Credit Score?
questions.description: The credit score is a crucial factor that lenders consider to determine your creditworthiness A higher credit score is essential for securing more favorable loan terms and interest rates, directly influencing loan eligibility and approval.

questions.question: Have you ever been defaulter

uiMeta.placeholder: Select the reason why you have low credit score

questions.question: What are the possible reasons behind your low CIBIL score?
questions.description: select all the applicable reasons to help us understand what may be impacting your credit score

options.label: Frequent use of full credit limit
options.value: Frequent use of full credit limit

options.label: Minimum due payments only on credit card
options.value: Minimum due payments only on credit card

questions.question: Do you have any obligation?
What type of existing loan do you have?
questions.description: Select the type of loan you currently have. This helps us understand your existing financial commitments better.

questions.question: Which bank is your existing loan with?
questions.description: Choose the bank where you have your current loan. This information helps us coordinate the loan takeover process if needed.

uiMeta.placeholder: How do you plan to close this loan?

questions.question: How would you like to handle this existing loan?
questions.description: Let us know if you'll close this loan yourself or if you'd like us to help with the closure process as part of your new loan.

options.label: will be closed by Top-up amount
options.value: will be closed by Top-up amount

questions.question: What is the EMI for this existing loan?
questions.description: EMI (monthly)

questions.question: remaining tenure
total limit
sanctioned limit (at the time of start)
remaining limit (current)
sanctioned tenure
remaining tenure
utilized amount
interest rate (p.a.)
How long would you like your plot loan term to be?
questions.description: Term is the full length of your loan - anywhere from 5 to 20 years. A longer term means you'll have lower monthly payments, but you'll pay more interest over time. Don't worry, you can change your mind later.

questions.question: About how much will the property you're buying, cost?
questions.description: Accurate numbers get you accurate offers from lenders.

questions.question: What is the total construction area of the plot?
questions.description: For multi-story buildings, multiply the constructable area by the number of floors. For example: If the plot area is 2000 square feet with a constructable area of 1500 square feet, and you plan to construct one and a half floors, the total construction area will be 1500 x 1.5 = 2250 square feet.

questions.question: Could you please provide the construction cost estimate?
questions.description: Although you will provide an estimate for the construction, lenders will conduct their own assessment and sanction up to a maximum 80% of their evaluated estimate.

questions.question: How much amount you have for the downpayment to purchase the plot?
If there is any difference between the "Property Value" and the "Agreement to Sell value" for the purpose of "registry"?
questions.description: In many areas of India, it is common practice to declare a property's value lower than its actual worth in the 'Agreement to Sell' (ATS document) or 'Sale Deed' to reduce stamp duty costs. While this may be prevalent and tempting, we strongly advise our customers to ensure that all transactions comply with legal requirements to avoid potential risks and complications.

questions.question: Is your Agreement to Sell (ATS) ready ?
Would you like to know our suggestion for ATS value (Registry Value) or you will decide by yourself?

switch.then: Property Value as per 'Agreement to Sell' (i.e. ATS document)?
The optimum Property Value for the 'Agreement to Sell' document is shown below.
Down Payment (own contribution amount) as per 'Agreement to Sell' document?
